title: Iceland: Near the Sundhnjukagigar volcano, a town on edge
description: Almost ten days after the volcanic eruption, life has not yet returned to normal in the small town of Grindavik. Nevertheless, Icelanders, who have always lived on a highly unstable seismic fault line, remain resilient.

title: 'Jacques Delors continued to play an important role in Franco-German dialogue after he retired from politics'
description: Jacqueline Hénard, former Paris correspondent for the weekly 'Die Zeit,' has written in an article for 'Le Monde' about the former European Commission president's relations with West Germany and then reunified Germany.

title: South Africa accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza at top UN court
description: The Israeli government rejected 'with disgust' the genocide accusations, calling it a 'blood libel.'

title: 'She was already dead inside': Forced suicide and the hidden victims of femicide
description: In 2022, 759 women in France took their own lives or attempted to because of harassment by a partner or former partner – an offense that is now recognized in the country, but remains difficult to prove.

title: Same-sex blessings open rift between Vatican and African churches
description: Representatives of the Catholic Church in Africa are hostile to the reform, with homosexuality prohibited in 32 countries on the continent.

title: 'The embarrassing silence of Arab countries on the Gaza conflict is cause for concern'
description: The Hamas attack of October 7 and Israel's indiscriminate retaliation have put the Palestinian question back at the top of the agenda, when it had been overshadowed by the normalization of relationships between Israel and several Arab countries, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Argentina formally rejects invitation to join BRICS
description: In letters sent to leaders of the BRICS bloc of powerful non-Western countries, Argentinian President Javier Milei declared his formal rejection of the membership offer, in line with his campaign promise that 'we are not going to ally with communists.'

title: 'US and EU sanctions on Russia are a major driver of global fragmentation'
description: The Polish economist Beata Javorcik fears that the geopolitical confrontation between, on the one hand, the United States and the European Union, and on the other, China and Russia, will hamper both international trade and the vital need for cooperation on climate change.

title: India investigates people smuggling after return of plane halted in France
description: Indian police said passengers of the Dubai-Nicaragua flight that was grounded in France had paid smugglers to help them reach the southern border of the United States.

title: French government says 95,000 police and military will be deployed for New Year's Eve
description: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin cited a heightened 'terrorist threat' requiring tight security.

title: China names former navy chief as new defence minister
description: The move comes at a criticial time, as Washington and Beijing reopen military talks and the latter increases pressure on Taiwan.

title: Angus Deaton: 'Health threats also will remain central to the story of progress and its reversals'
description: The winner of the 2015 Nobel Prize in Economics questions in an op-ed whether the health setbacks of the past decade are temporary or only the beginning of worse to come.

title: Russian court convicts Navalny ally Ksenia Fadeyeva for 'extremism'
description: Ksenia Fadeyeva, who headed Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny's political office in Tomsk, was sentenced to nine years in prison.

title: Over 100 Russian missiles and drones hit Ukraine
description: The strikes, which came after an attack on a Russian ship in Crimea, have killed at least 12 people and injured at least 70.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Egypt proposes three-step ceasefire plan
description: A Hamas delegation is due in Cairo to discuss a plan to end the war in Gaza, in a context of strikes near hospitals, which have drawn outcry from humanitarian NGOs. Also, Israel and Cyprus have tentatively approved a maritime corridor to provide aid to Gaza.

title: Macron's support for Depardieu: 'Mr. President, your words deny all abused women the right to be heard and believed'
description: In an open letter to Emmanuel Macron, members of the MeTooMedia association criticize the French president's defense of Gérard Depardieu, who is charged with rape.

title: Writer of open letter defending Depardieu is a Zemmour supporter with far-right connections
description: Yannis Ezziadi, a little-known actor, is a friend of Sarah Knafo, Eric Zemmour's adviser and partner. He has previously written about 'ethnic French people' being 'culturally threatened by an atmospheric Islam.'

title: Emmanuel Macron: 'Our strategy must be to speed up the ecological transition as well as the fight against poverty'
description: In an op-ed in Le Monde, the French president proposes a new global climate pact and calls for a reform of global financial governance to better involve emerging countries.

title: 'France's Stonewall': A trial that became symbolic in the history of gay struggles
description: 'The underground years' (4/5). Arrested in a Paris bar in 1977, homosexuals refused for the first time to show contrition and used their trial as a platform against 'repression.'

title: US warship shoots down drone and missile fired by Houthi rebels
description: The US on Thursday imposed sanctions against a network involved in financing Houthi rebels who have been launching attacks on commercial shipping vessels in the Red Sea.

title: 'Jacques Delors' Europe was warm and welcoming'
description: In an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' German political scientist Ulrike Guérot pays tribute to the endearing personality of the former president of the European Commission.

title: Children are the new victims of the fentanyl epidemic in the US
description: This synthetic opiate, which has already caused a wave of deaths in California, is now leading to deadly overdoses in children under five due to its fumes.

title: Le Monde's favorite albums of 2023
description: We looked back at our music editors' favorite records, including from Blur, Killer Mike, Gabriels, Archie Shepp, Albin de la Simone and Berlioz.

title: Prince Bernhard's Nazi ties embarrasses the Dutch royal family
description: A recently published book proves that Prince Bernhard of Lippe-Biesterfeld, who died in 2004, was indeed a member of the National Socialist German Workers' Party from 1933 to 1936, a fact he consistently denied during his lifetime.

title: Trump disqualified from presidential primary in Maine
description: Maine's Democratic secretary of state on Thursday removed former President Donald Trump from the state's presidential primary ballot, citing the US Constitution's insurrection clause.
